description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. Headings in red with black vocalization. European paper. Leaves missing between fol. 6 and 7, 14 and 15. Fol. 55 consists of two pasted leaves.
author: Risālah al-dāmighah lil-fāsiq
abstract: Acephalous and defective copy of a collection of twenty-five texts of the Druze community, comprising texts 15-23 and 25-40 in Sylvestre de Sacy's description of Druze writings in Exposé de la religion des Druzes (1838). The Risālat al-Inṣināʼ (text 24) does not appear in this copy.
contents: 27. fol. 140b-143a: [Short texts by another hand, starting with the words "Maʻrifat al-ʻaql annahu ʻillat al-ʻilal" ; "Dhikr al-maqāmāt al-ʻashrah al-ʻAlī al-Bār", etc.]
extent: 143 leaves: paper ; 150 x 105 (105 x 85) mm. bound to 155 x 110 mm.
title: Risālah al-dāmighah lil-fāsiq ... [etc.].
creator: رسالة الدامغة للفاسق
subject: Druzes—Sacred books
binding note: Brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Both covers have a central panel with a red stamped mandorla, outlined in gold, developing into a chain motif linking to the outer border on the vertical axis. Gold motifs in the inner corners. Outer border consists of a guilloche and several fillets. Portion of the same decoration on the envelope flap. Line of flower motifs on the fore-edge flap. Paper pastedowns. Leather with one flower motif on the fore-edge flap. Spine wanting.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
